sense.gloss: to polish, to shine, to burnish, to scour, to scrub, to brush (teeth), to grind (e.g. a lens)
to refine (a skill, etc.), to improve, to hone, to polish (up), to cultivate (one's character)
refining (a skill, knowledge, etc.), applying oneself (to study), disciplining oneself
diligent application (to work or study), cultivating one's character by studying hard
mutual encouragement (to improve), working hard together, friendly rivalry
daruma, tumbling doll, round, red-painted good-luck doll in the shape of Bodhidharma, with a blank eye to be completed when a person's wish is granted
veteran, battle-worn, schooled by adversity in many battles, hard-bitten, rich in experience, very experienced
Harima (former province located in the southwestern part of present-day Hyōgo Prefecture)
to polish up, to shine up
to wear away, to rub down, to abrade
to rub to pieces, to grind into powder
to erase, to efface, to rub out
water that has been used to wash rice
wear and tear, abrasion, friction loss
to mash, to grind, to pulverize, to pulverise, to deface
to dissipate (a fortune), to run through, to lose
to rub, to chafe, to strike (match), to file, to frost (glass)
to lose (e.g. a match), to forfeit, to squander one's money (e.g. through gambling, Pachinko, etc.)
to wear out, to become worn
to lose one's innocence, to become sly
to sharpen, to hone, to whet, to grind
to scour, to polish, to burnish
defacement, abrasion, wear and tear, crushing of a nerve
polishing one's sword, improving one's talents or knowledge
ground stone tool, polished stone tool
ball of flames, mass of flames, body covered with flames
ceremony held in honor (honour) of Bodhidharma (October 5)

sdata.j: ↑靴↑↓くつ↓をよく↑磨↑↓みが↓いてくれ。
sdata.e: Give my shoes a good shine.

sdata.j: ↑靴↑↓くつ↓をブラシで↑磨↑↓みが↓く↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓がある。↑泥↑↓どろ↓で↑汚↑↓よご↓れているから。
sdata.e: Your shoes need brushing. They are muddy.

sdata.j: ↑学生↑↓がくせい↓は↑読書↑↓どくしょ↓の↑技能↑↓ぎのう↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓くべきだ。
sdata.e: Students should develop their reading skills.

sdata.j: ↑外出↑↓がいしゅつ↓の↑前↑↓まえ↓に↑必↑↓かなら↓ず↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓きなさい。
sdata.e: Don't forget to polish your shoes before you go out!

sdata.j: ↑外↑↓そと↓へ↑出↑↓で↓る↑前↑↓まえ↓に↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓きなさい。
sdata.e: Shine your shoes before going out.

sdata.j: ↑会話↑↓かいわ↓↑力↑↓りょく↓に↑磨↑↓みが↓きをかけるため、↑彼↑↓かれ↓はフランスに↑行↑↓い↓った。
sdata.e: He went to France to brush up on his speaking ability.

sdata.j: ↑一↑↓いち↓↑日↑↓にち↓にせめて↑二↑↓に↓↑回↑↓かい↓は↑歯↑↓は↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓くべきだ。
sdata.e: You should brush your teeth at least twice a day.

sdata.j: ロンドン↑滞在↑↓たいざい↓↑中↑↓ちゅう↓に↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑英語↑↓えいご↓の↑腕↑↓うで↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いた。
sdata.e: He brushed up his English during his stay in London.

sdata.j: パーティーに↑行↑↓い↓く↑前↑↓まえ↓に↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓くべきですよ。
sdata.e: You should polish your shoes before you go to the party.

sdata.j: どんなに↑眠↑↓ねむ↓くても、↑歯↑↓は↓は↑磨↑↓みが↓きなさい。
sdata.e: Brush your teeth, however sleepy you are.

sdata.j: ちゃんと↑歯↑↓は↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いていますか。
sdata.e: Are you brushing your teeth properly?

sdata.j: タロー↑君↑↓くん↓、↑歯↑↓は↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いていらっしゃい。
sdata.e: Taro, go and brush your teeth.

sdata.j: その↑靴↑↓くつ↓↑磨↑↓みが↓きを↑使↑↓つか↓ってもいいですか。
sdata.e: May I use the shoe polish?

sdata.j: そのなべを↑磨↑↓みが↓いていただけませんか。
sdata.e: Would you scrape that rusty pan?

sdata.j: スーザンは↑父親↑↓ちちおや↓の↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いた。
sdata.e: Susan shined her father's shoes.

sdata.j: この↑布↑↓ぬの↓で↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いてご↑覧↑↓らん↓なさい。
sdata.e: Why don't you polish the shoes with this cloth?

sdata.j: この↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓く↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓がある。
sdata.e: These shoes need polishing.

sdata.j: この↑金属↑↓きんぞく↓は↑磨↑↓みが↓くとつやがでる。
sdata.e: This metal burnishes well.

sdata.j: このタイヤはだいぶん↑磨↑↓す↓り↑減↑↓へ↓っている。
sdata.e: This tire is showing wear.

sdata.j: ケンは、↑英語↑↓えいご↓に↑磨↑↓みが↓きをかけたいと↑思↑↓おも↓っている。
sdata.e: Ken wishes to brush up his English.

sdata.j: ケイトが↑演技↑↓えんぎ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓くために↑注↑↓そそ↓ぐ↑力↑↓ちから↓を↑邪魔↑↓じゃま↓する↑物↑↓もの↓は、↑何↑↓なに↓もありませんでした。
sdata.e: Nothing could hinder Kate from using all her energy to polish her performances.

sdata.j: きみは↑英語↑↓えいご↓に↑磨↑↓みが↓きをかけるべきだ。
sdata.e: You have to polish your English.

sdata.j: お↑客↑↓きゃく↓が↑雑↑↓ざつ↓な↑作↑↓づく↓りのスタンドに↑座↑↓すわ↓って↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いてもらっている。
sdata.e: A customer is having his shoes shined on a slapped-together stand.

sdata.j: ↑詐欺↑↓さぎ↓↑師↑↓し↓は↑新↑↓あら↓たに↑人↑↓ひと↓をだますまえに、↑目隠↑↓めかく↓し、すなわち、↑人↑↓ひと↓をだますテクニックを↑磨↑↓みが↓く。
sdata.e: A confidence man polishes his "hood winking" or "eye-washing" techniques before bilking a new victim.

sdata.j: ↑昨夜↑↓さくや↓は↑歯↑↓は↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓かないで↑寝↑↓ね↓てしまった。
sdata.e: Last night, I went to bed without brushing my teeth.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑靴↑↓くつ↓は↑磨↑↓みが↓く↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓がある。
sdata.e: My shoes need polishing.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑靴↑↓くつ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いてもらった。
sdata.e: I had my shoes cleaned.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑床↑↓ゆか↓と↑家具↑↓かぐ↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓いた。
sdata.e: I polished up the floor and furniture.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑食後↑↓しょくご↓にいつも↑歯↑↓は↓を↑磨↑↓みが↓くわけではない。
sdata.e: I don't always brush my teeth after I eat.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑寝↑↓ね↓る↑前↑↓まえ↓にくつを↑磨↑↓みが↓くことにしている。
sdata.e: I make it a point to shine my shoes before I go to bed.
